name: OpenRecordButton
title: Open Record Button
description: A simple button component that intelligently opens entity records using metadata to determine primary keys
functionalRequirements:
## Intelligent Record Opening Button

### Core Purpose
- **Smart record opening** - uses metadata to determine primary keys
- **Zero configuration** - just needs entity name and record
- **Handles complex keys** - supports composite primary keys
- **MJ Explorer integration** - opens records in the standard way
- **Minimal props** - abstracts all complexity

### Key Capabilities
- Automatically determines primary key fields from metadata
- Handles single and composite primary keys
- Extracts key values from record object
- Customizable button text and styling
- Disabled state when record missing
- Error handling for missing metadata

### Use Cases
- Open buttons in data grids
- Record cards with view actions
- After-save navigation
- Quick access in dashboards
- Drill-down from charts
technicalDesign:
## Metadata-Driven Implementation

### Design Philosophy
- **Metadata aware** - uses entity metadata for intelligence
- **Minimal surface area** - only entityName and record props
- **Convention over configuration** - smart defaults
- **Abstracted complexity** - handles all key logic internally

### Technical Implementation
- Looks up entity in utilities.md.Entities array
- Finds primary key fields from entity metadata
- Extracts key values from provided record
- Builds proper OpenEntityRecord callback parameters
- Handles both single and composite keys

### Key Detection Logic
1. Find entity by name in metadata
2. Get primary key fields from entity definition
3. Extract values from record for each key field
4. Pass field/value pairs to OpenEntityRecord

### Error Handling
- Missing entity metadata
- Record without key values
- Invalid entity names
- Callback failures
